comm: some swing straight away. Doesn't pose much threat to the batsman though with Yadav lining a good length ball well outside off and allowing Guptill the luxury of a leave
that's better. Applause from a well-packed slip cordon as they wanted a fuller delivery on fifth stump curving away from the right-hander. Guptill, wisely, left it alone
oooh, went for a drive on the up, and the ball just dies on the fielder at mid-off.
good length ball on off stump, defended with a little stride forward and head over the ball
attempt at a quick single after Latham tapped the back of a length ball down into the off side. The men in the ring are too quick for such things
inside edge as Latham is unsure whether to play with a horizontal or a vertical bat. The ball was short, but the line was too close, cramping him and creating the uncertainty
132kph, starts with a very wide delivery outside off. It was a drivable length, but Latham is happy to see it through to the wicketkeeper
continues plying the left-hander with teasers outside off. Latham adamantly leaves
third time's not the charm. Pandya's line strays a little too far away outside off for the umpire's liking. His length has been good though
hits a good length, but the angle is again going across Latham. Once he knew it pitched outside off, he could leave again. His fourth in a row
132 kph, that's nice. A lot closer to Latham's off stump, but he continues to leave the ball
finally throws his hands at a wide one and he gets an outside edge to third man. A shorter length has drawn him into the shot

indecision! And he has somehow put bat to ball while trying to leave it outside off. A fifth stump line created doubts in his mind. He was bowled off the elbow playing his very shot in the Tests. This time he gets a single to third man
the drive on the up, promising signs for a batsman. Guptill came forward and lashed a wide, length ball through point.

back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers. Kohli at short cover came at the ball, and takes a tumble having lost his footing. May have hurt his left hand, the fingers jammed into the hard turf
brings a straight bat down on a length ball attacking middle stump.
indulges in a shimmy down the pitch, and makes room to open up the off side. But Yadav folllows him with a back of a length delivery. The batsman adjusts with a single to mid-on
straight bat push to mid-off, but since he played it with soft hands, Pandya has to rush forward, and to his right a bit to get to the ball. And in that time, they've taken another quick single
back of a length on off stump, and it is that length that allows Guptill the time to get back and across and work it wide of mid-on

he has smashed that! That shot must have been bubbling up all through the tour! He came at the ball, cleared the front leg and swung free. More importantly, he swung straight. That's his strength and it hits the third tier of the stands over long-on
back of a length on off stump, Guptill stays on the back foot, besides the ball and guides it behind point
dabbed to point, looked up to see if his partner would respond with Pandey at point having to come in a long way to get to the ball. Easy single, well taken
good length ball outside off, Guptill lets it pass him
one-bounce to mid-off. The drives on the up are coming out a lot more frequently now. Pandya invited it with a fuller length on off stump
top shot, an on-drive that had all the timing in the world behind it, but Yadav moves quickly to his left in his followthrough and saves a boundary

wry smile from the bowler as he sees a thick outside edge fly over the slip cordon. It was the offcutter, thrown very wide. Latham chased it and this time he used hard hands, which allowed the ball to go past the lone slip

fell short of slip! But great work from Rahane. Stayed low, put his body behind the ball and is able to to cover the ball despite it coming at him on the half-volley. Top ball from Yadav too, back of a length, pinning Latham to the crease and squaring him with with some seam away
gets forward and blocks on middle
slower ball on leg stump, Latham adjusts to the lack of pace and turns it through midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, Latham is up on his toes to defend this 140 kph delivery
sees width, sees red and slaps the short ball to point. Stand and deliver stuff
a little bit of room allows him to slash a back of a length ball in front of point. It's coming onto the bat very nicely
keeps back against the shortish length and punches it into the covers. Pandya bowling 138 kph

goes wide of the crease and delivers a fine short ball at 136 kph. Guptill had instinctively loaded up a pull shot, having got across to the off side. But he finds the ball coming at his left shoulder, cramping him up. That he mistimed the shot ends up in his favour. The man at deep midwicket had too much ground to cover to prevent the two
142 kph, beauty! It was pitched up this time, a little outside off to draw Guptill to poke away from his body. Then a hint of seam away beats him

he usually looks majestic while sending balls out of the ground, but this time he seems to have simply skewed the ball. And yet... Overpitched delivery on middle, Guptill made a little room, almost seemed like he had gave himself too much. The bat face turned on impact, but the ball landed into the crowd beyond extra cover
back of a length on off stump, defended
has that gone all the way too? New Zealand loving the pace on the Mohali pitch. And yes, Latham's pulled it beyond the square leg boundary. Saw the short ball early and tonked it
on the pads again, Latham flicks it to long leg
he'd have to bowl that again. Dug in seriously short and the ball balloons over Guptill's head

pins him in front of middle! It's an issue that has long plagued Guptill. His front leg doesn't come down the pitch, it goes across instead. So when the ball is pitched up on off stump - like this one - and gets just enough inward movement - like this one - he's in trouble. The bat has to come around the pad. It's not quick enough.
full and wide, Williamson drives to mid-off.

very minimalist. The ball was pitched up, so he went forward. It was in line with the stumps, so he came at it with a straight bat. Does very little other than what's required, Williamson, and that helps him time the ball past mid-on
shortish on leg stump, flicked to long leg
stands up tall against a shortish delivery and drills it to the right of cover. It's a difficult stroke to pull off, but it's one of his favourites
shuffles across to try and dab the ball to third man, but he's cramped up by a bit by the ball on seventh stump. Gets an inside edge
fuller delivery, well wide of off stump at 137 kph, left alone
back of a length and outside off, no shot offered
138 kph, waits for it and carves a shortish delivery behind point
back of a length on fourth stump, Williamson defends
full and wide, draws him into a big drive, but it seems like he had overestimated the pace on the ball. The bat's there before it's arrived, and the face closes. Mistimed down the pitch
offcutter, at a full length just outside off, defended
lets the good length ball come to him, but his glide off the straight bat to third man is cut off by Rahane at a fine gully

that's poor stuff from Mishra at the third man boundary. He seems to have overrun the ball, dived too late and it sneaked behind him. It's fullish, but quite wide. Williamson gets low with it and steers the ball backward of point
though that fine gully has been placed to dissuade the late cut, Williamson continues to play it. Manages to get it past Rahane's right
and he's bowling quick enough to indicate that right shoulder is quite fine. This 137 kph delivery gets a kick off the pitch and beats Williamson's glide to third man as a result of extra bounce
back of a length on off stump, turned to midwicket

magnificent! And again, it was immensely efficient. He saw a full length ball. It was wide as well. He realised there was a gap between cover and mid-off, waiting to be exploited, and he does so with a pristine straight bat

edged but falls short of the wicketkeeper. Williamson's technique is that he plays the ball inside the line, and uses soft hands to make sure the nicks done carry. So even a really good ball, like this one, which pitched on a good length on off stump and straightened, doesn't lead to a wicket
back of a length on off stump, defended
back of a length on off stump, directed into the covers
tossed up outside off, eased to the left of mid-off
shortish and angled into the left-hander from around the stumps, Latham rocks back to punch it into the covers
looped up on middle, swept to deep square leg
drifted down leg, and Latham went for the sweep, as he should have, but fails to make connection
moves back to the shortish delivery and flicks it through midwicket

a string of appeals from the bowler for lbw, but it would have missed leg stump. It was a flatter delivery, doesn't turn much. Williamson played the trajectory, getting low to pull. Doesn't make a connection
driven to long-on
gets on top of a shortish delivery and drags it from outside off to short midwicket
leans back and guides a shortish delivery outside off to point
gave away his intentions - jumping forward and across the stumps - which allows Bumrah to shorten his length. Williamson blocks to cover
plenty of width on offer and Williamson creams it in front of point. He can hit that shot anywhere in front of behind point. But Rahane at that fine gully may be preventing him from going too fine
slower ball - pushed full on leg stump - Latham has spotted it and flicks it to the right of long leg
moves around the stumps for this back of a length delivery on off stump, defended
flighted on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket
comes into the left-hander - it was intended to - and Latham, who had been waiting on the back foot, hoping to cut, has to suddenly bring down a straight bat
shortish and outside off, cut to point
pushed through down leg, Latham tries to give it a little glance to the fine leg boundary, but it's too far
phew, the power in his sweep is amazing! He may have premeditated the shot, but he got the perfect ball to make sure he doesn't pay for it. Well wide, and just short to leverage it
looped up outside off, drives it serenely through the covers

that goes straight and Williamson has played all across it! Went to sweep - which is dangerous by itself when a ball is in line with the stumps - but this one was so slow. The batsman was through the shot too early and as such was a sitting duck. Jadhav must have magic fingers... well, he used only the forefinger to work on that ball to make sure it didn't turn. New Zealand's best batsman falls to India's most part-time of part-timers
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
flighted on off stump, driven back at the bowler
leading edge as Taylor again brings a closed face down from gully, looking to flick the ball against the turn towards mid-on. Gets a single to point
rocks back and flicks a shortish delivery through to the left of deep midwicket
goes back and blocks a flatter delivery on off stump
driven to long-off
plants his front foot down and plays a bit inside the line. Hint of turn takes the outside edge
comes down the track and kicks it away as Mishra fires the ball into the leg side
shimmies down to block, inside edge slots the ball into a vacant area at square leg
flicks a delivery off middle to midwicket. It was quick too, intended to get him to play across the line and have him leg before
flat and down leg, flicked away to long leg
flighted on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket
flighted onto off stump, nudged to the right of square leg
shortish delivery, there for the cut shot, which Taylor plays reasonably well, but point moves quickly to his left and stops the run. Kohli the man
gets forward to a fuller delivery on off stump and drives to mid-off. Taylor's not being allowed easy runs
good length ball coming in at him, Taylor is waiting on his front foot and then brings his bat around and in front of his pad to block
comes down the track and drives to long-off
flighted outside off, Latham eases it towards point. That brings drinks onto the field
flatter delivery on leg stump, punched to long-on.
flighted on off stump, driven to extra cover
quicker through the air, and it was from the back of the hand. Must have been one of his four or so googlies. Taylor was defending blindly, hoping for turn, and just about keeps it out
too short, so it doesn't matter which way the ball is going, Taylor rocks back and bashes it over midwicket
pushed through on middle and leg, defended. Slider
flighted on off stump, defended
goes back to a good length ball on off stump and turns it to short fine leg
quicker, on a fuller length on off stump, Latham flicks it towards square leg
flighted onto middle and leg, Latham moved across to try and glance it, finds short fine leg
sees some flight, and that the ball was outside off stump, so he goes for the sweep. Hits it along the ground to deep square leg
good length ball on off stump, defended
comes down the track and hits the good length ball back to Patel
strides down the track to take a flighted ball on leg stump to long-on
draws him forward with a tossed up delivery outside off, Taylor drives to point
a shade short, Taylor's read the length early, stays back and slices the ball to the left of point. Pandey does well
brings down a straight bat to a quicker delivery on leg stump and gets a single to long-on
whips a loopy delivery on middle stump to deep midwicket. New Zealand have got their hundred up
pushed down the ground, forcefully
nicely bowled. It was a bit fuller than the batsman thought - but still he went back because of the trajectory being flat. Nudged to midwicket
moves back again to a good length ball because it was flat again. Has to cut off middle stump, and had he missed it he would have been bowled

decides to come down the track now - trying to hit himself out of trouble, but Patel puts him in deeper trouble by firing it in and making him hurry into a cut shot first, and then hurry back to his crease because the ball was dribbling back to Dhoni
flighted outside off, swept calmly to deep square leg
drilled down to long-on
flighted on leg stump, Latham comes down the pitch for a flick, but gets struck on the pad
tossed up on middle and leg, Latham makes sure he can leverage it with a sweep by planting his front leg across. Single to deep square leg
flighted onto middle and leg, Taylor gets inside the line and drives through cover

all he did was chip the ball over the top. And yet it went for a one-bounce four over the bowler's head. He had been deceived by the ball dipping on him. So despite his efforts to get down the track, he wasn't to the pitch. Checked his shot as a result, but somehow the timing remains pristine
pushed through quicker, and a shade outside off, Latham stays back and pushes it into the covers
nudged away through midwicket
too straight and Latham moves back and across to flick the ball to short fine leg. Could have done better there
half an appeal for leg before as Latham sweeps a ball from outside off. Made sure to plant the front leg forward and across outside the line of the stumps
goes back, stands tall, and punches a flatter delivery to long-on
shortish and outside off, sliced away to the third man boundary. Patel's been bowling this length, and has been successful with it. But this time there was just enough width for Taylor to work with
flighted on off stump, driven wide of long-on

top-edge, does deep backward square leg have a chance? It's Rahane done there, running in, preparing to dive forward, but the ball falls short of him. Premeditated sweep doesn't go right for Latham with Patel pulling his length back just enough
tossed up on off stump and Latham jumps out to drive towards long-off, where Rahane has to sprint to his left and throw himself flat on his stomach to make a sprawling save
beauty. Flight and dip close to off stump, and just enough turn away to beat Taylor's edge as he comes forward to defend
fuller now, a bit wider, driven to the right of sweeper cover, where Bumrah makes a sliding stop
quickish length ball on middle and leg, defended into the on side
floated up full on off stump, driven inside-out to the right of sweeper cover
full, slanted across Latham, blocked back to the bowler
ooh, risky. Looks for the late cut as this slides on with the arm, towards off stump, squeezes it out to short third man
length ball angling into the pads, clipped away to the right of deep square leg
flat length ball on off stump, defended back to Axar
quick and flat, angling in towards off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball on middle, no turn, punched to long-on
looks to come out of his crease and Axar fires it in flat outside off, blocked back to the bowler
short and wide, Taylor clatters it away, square-cutting fiercely to the point boundary
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
short ball, angling in and rising above Taylor's right shoulder. Taylor is a little late on his pull, hits it uppishly, and doesn't time it at all, falls safely to the right of midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
slower ball outside off, fairly full, driven crisply and Pandey dives to his left from cover to stop it
another bouncer, this time Taylor ignores it, swaying out of the way
down the track, Axar bowls it full at his feet, and Latham clips it down to long-on to bring up yet another half-century. What a tour this has been for him
a couple of steps out of his crease, punches the full ball back to Axar
a bit of flight wide of off stump, and Taylor says thanks for the width and flat-bats it to the boundary to the right of sweeper cover
flat, angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket. Wants a single but Latham sends him back, wisely
flat, angling into leg stump, clipped to Bumrah at backward square leg
slower now, length ball outside off. Taylor looks for the quick single, can't quite find the gap to the left of short extra cover
back of a length ball, from around the stumps, pushed into the covers
steps up to a fuller delivery and a closed face of the bat sends it to mid-off. Usually tends to play those balls at fifth stump through the covers. Perhaps the angle is making him change his game
good length ball on middle, nudged to mid-on
dug in considerably short. Almost pitched in his own half of the pitch, and it soars over Taylor's head
width offered, which Taylor accepts with a cut shot. Stays beside the ball and carves it to the left of third man.
shortish on leg stump, nudged through midwicket
good length ball outside off, from around the stumps again, slid to backward point
pushed through on middle and off, defended
that's no fun. It's a short delivery outside off. Taylor goes for the cut, but finds the fielder at point
tossed up on off stump, smashed down the ground to long-off
tossed up on middle, Latham is down the track to push to long-on
flatter delivery on middle, Taylor is down the pitch to flick it to midwicket
the old faithful slog sweep. He was able to pull it off with Patel offering length, and then again the room to free the arms. Powerful strike
flighted on leg stump, Latham advances and flicks the ball to deep square leg. Placed it well enough for a couple of runs despite a direct hit from Rahane at the bowler's end
flighted on off stump, swept, if not quite perfectly, to deep backward square leg

absolute beauty! It was slow. It was tossed up. It was drifting in. And it dips too. Poor Taylor, he was suckered into coming forward, suckered into flicking agains the turn, which dances past the leading edge, through to Dhoni who completes the stumping. Dream delivery for a legspinner
attempts a push into the covers, but the tossed up delivery dips before he is to the pitch, and then has the opportunity to turn. Goes off the inside edge to midwicket
flatter delivery outside off, driven to the left of cover
flighted on leg stump, nudged towards square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
taps a flatter delivery on off stump down to long-on
dumps him down the ground! Skips down the pitch and then it was simply a matter of using his power to his advantage

he's getting wickets off full tosses! Anderson looks to lash it over cover, but the connection is made a little too high on that and the ball deflects to mid-off. Rahane has to move to his left a bit and takes the catch at chest high
goes back and blocks the flatter delivery outside off
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
goes wider of the crease for a good length ball on off stump, defended

looks like Mishra has another stumping! Dhoni is very certain of it. The loopy legspinner. It's a damn fine sight in cricket. Seduces Ronchi to drive at it, and in his haste, he's dragged his back foot out of the crease. Then it turns, oh so beautifully past the outside edge and straight into the wicketkeeper's waiting hands. Dhoni is so good with these things. Has his hands right by the stumps, not behind them like some others, and has a lot less distance to cover
he isn't sure which way the ball will turn. This is the googly, so it turns away from the left-hander. The length being short allows him to adjust and get a single through point
pushed through outside off, punched to deep cover
worked away through midwicket
tucks the length ball through midwicket away
beats the outside edge of Neesham, who was hanging back, waiting for the ball to turn away. But it doesn't. Just straightens enough
defends it down the pitch
punches the ball from the crease to long-on
goes back, takes the time offered by Jadhav bowling short and tucks it through midwicket

picks out short cover with laser guided precision! Latham's cover drive, for once, fails. It was tossed up wide so he was within his right to go for the shot. But he should have kept it down with fielders up in the circle
moves back to drill a flatter delivery from around the stumps to the sweeper
full delivery on off stump, pushed into the covers
yorker at the base of off stump! Santner has to whip his front leg out of the way to bring his bat down on the ball and save his wicket

corker of a ball, pitched up on middle stump, high on pace, and it jags away off the deck past the outside egde. Santner was trying to drive to mid-on, he had to with the ball starting straight. But it misbehaves
attempts another push-drive with an open face, but the fuller ball takes the outside edge to third man
sweetly hit to the long-on boundary. It was a tad overpitched and Neesham addresses it with a straight bat
good length ball on middle and leg, Neesham keeps it out
goes wide of the crease for a tossed up delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
goes straight on with the arm, and Santner who was backing away has to hurry into punching the ball to short cover
tossed up outside off, inviting the drive through cover, Santner's beaten
overpitched outside off, driven to deep cover
shortish and outside off, cut to deep point
flatter delivery outside off, driven to the left of the sweeper. That takes us to drinks
defends a good length ball on off stump to cover

held on the pitch, produced the leading edge and point takes the catch gleefully. It was back of a length. It was on the pads. The flick shot wasn't the worst one, but he is trumped by the ball coming at him a lot slower than he expected. Kohli, the catcher, sticks his tongue out in celebration. Santner, the departing batsman, jams his bat into the turf. Sums up the theme of the match
good length ball, poked through the gap between point and cover
back of a length and outside off, guides it between point and cover and his timing is outrageous. Definitely did not intend to hit that for four
no slip, and the outside edge skips away to the third man boundary. Good length ball, came in off the pitch, Southee is rooted to the crease, driving away from his bat
dug in short and outside off, Southee tries to ramp it over the keeper but is unsuccessful
flighted on off stump, driven back at the bowler
tossed up wide, Neesham drives to long-off
full toss on middle and off stump, Southee reaches for it and attempts to shovel it through midwicket. Hits Jadhav at short leg and wanders off a lot straighter than it was intended
stays back and defends on off stump
flighted on off stump, nudges to mid-on
slower ball, pitched back of a length, Southee lets it come on, guides it off the open face to point
back of a length on leg stump, eased in front of point

spears in the yorker on middle and leg, Southee is put in an awkward position - his feet splayed and his bat coming down in between them to flick the ball to midwicket. Pandey does well, moving to his right and sending a direct hit at the batsman's end. But Neesham is safe
did that keep low? Neesham was buckled over after managing to flick the ball, pitching back of a length and coming at his off stump from around the wicket
pushed into the covers
lands a yorker on off stump, steers it into the covers
makes sure to keep the cover drive along the ground as Yadav bowls a full and wide one from around the stumps
back of a length and outside off, dabbed behind point for a quick single
seems to be generating some inswing now. Looked for the yorker at leg stump, didn't quite get it right. Inside edge onto the pad
back of a length and outside off, steered to point

drags it on! India keep changing bowlers, and they keep getting wickets in the first over. This was a short ball, Southee went for the pull but was into the shot too early. Inside edge clatters back onto the stumps
full, swinging in towards middle and leg, he stays put at his crease and works the ball to midwicket
firmly struck! Neesham did everything right with this shot, from picking up the half-volley early and hitting it with a straight bat to the long-on boundary
shortish and outside off, Neesham lets it come on and taps it to point
shortish on off stump, worked away through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended
attempts to force a short delivery on off stump through point. Finds the fielder
back of a length on off stump, pushed through the covers
backs away from the length ball outside off and pats it to cover
flicked through to deep square leg
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off. Quick single, well taken. Saw Pandya was on the edge of the circle and exploited it
top bouncer from Yadav! Plenty of heat with 142 kph. Right over off stump. Too high to pull. Henry can only avoid it
short ball, with just a hint of width, Henry backs away and clatters it between backward and cover point
back of a length on middle, pushed down to mid-off
fires it in on middle and leg, defended
that was the slider off the front of the hand, pitching on leg stump, hurrying the batsman. Neesham tries to flick, has to settle for a single to square leg
googly on middle and off, Henry stays deep in his crease, reads the ball off the pitch and pushes to long-on
oooh, that's lovely. It was the googly again, to the left-hander. Neesham was looking for the legspinner, played with a closed face, but it turns the other way and gets a leading edge
another googly, and Neesham goes for a sweep simply because it was tossed up outside off. Dips under his bat
pushed through outside off, Neesham moves back and across to block, uncertainly
good length ball on leg stump, hit back down the pitch
dug in short, and it slides down leg as Henry avoids it.
smears it through the offside! He didn't quite have all the room he wanted, but Henry stayed beside it, and simply forced it through the gap between cover and mid-off
stay in line with the back of a length delivery on middle and blocks it
very full on off stump, flicked to midwicket, while trying to run away from the ball.
good length ball on off stump, Henry punches it to mid-off
dug in short, a bit too much actually, Henry ducks. The umpire waits, and waits, and waits, before calling it wide for height
whips a full ball curving in at him through the air through midwicket
gets the toe end to a cut shot, which deflects the shortish delivery onto Dhoni's right pad
beautiful bowling. He held that back a touch, and the ball gripped the pitch and turned past the outside edge of the forward defensive
flighted delivery on off stump, Henry's drive is inside the line of the ball and as such he gets an outside edge
cuts it to the sweeper
flatter delivery from around the wicket, Neesham whacks it to long-on

pulls out the reverse sweep, and though he picked the right ball - it was the googly drifting outside off, so he hit it with the turn, rolled his wrists over the ball to keep it down too - but finds short third man
works the ball between deep midwicket and long-on. Placed well enough for a couple
flighted delivery on off stump, defended into the covers
looped up outside off, thumped down to long-on

bisects deep midwicket and long-on! Pure bottom-handed power. It was tossed up on leg stump, Neesham waited for it and made sure to keep his bat straight enough to pick the gap. Kohli was running to his left, Pandey to his right, neither had much of a chance though Kohli seems to suggest Pandey should have dived
goes for the sweep against a fuller delivery on off stump, sent to deep square leg, and that ends a fine spell from Mishra. Took 2 for 46 in 10
falls over as he tries to flick, gets struck on the pad, but it had pitched outside leg. Patel is bowling to the left-hander from around the stumps
flighted on leg stump, worked away to long leg
length ball outside off, dragged to the square leg boundary with a powerful sweep. It was flat in trajectory, so he could get under it and use his strength
shortish and outside off, cut to the sweeper

good work from Pandey on the point boundary, running to his left and putting in the dive to stop a well-placed, superbly timed cut from Neesham. He has not looked all that comfortable against spin, but has shown a willingness to stick around and as a result is scoring at over run-a-ball. Fine innings. Could be vital to their prospects
yorks Neesham on leg stump, but he keeps it out
starts with a short ball, just outside off, too high for Henry to catch up with as he tries the ramp shot to third man
back of a length on middle and off, steered through cover point
slower ball, on off stump, Neesham has picked it, and finds a single by blocking into the covers with soft hands
oooh, short ball puts Henry on his bum! It wasn't those balloons over the batsman's head, posing no threat to him. Came at his chest, and it kept following him too
short again, Henry this time pulls to long leg
back of a length and outside off, sliced to deep point
good length ball on off stump, Neesham moves away from it and blocks it to the right of where mid-off would have been
jumps across to pull a short delivery off his hips to long leg. Brings up the 50-run stand for the ninth wicket

top shot! Neesham is playing a little gem! This was only slightly short, but having spent time at the crease, having understood the pace in it, and perhaps helped by it being a fast bowler coming at him, he is able to quickly rock back and pull the ball through straight midwicket
142kph full toss, and that goes straight up. Long-off is back so it lands safely and Henry is able to rush through for a second too. Full-length, desperate dive to get the extra run
back of a length on off stump, Neesham defends, and thinks about a single, but Yadav races up to prevent it. Could even have been bowled with the ball dribbling back. Only barely missed the leg stump

that's his maiden fifty in ODIs! Been there long enough to earn this slice of luck. He stands and slaps at a back of a length ball outside off and it takes the leading edge to the third man boundary. Fine innings. Fine counterattack.
fierce drive into the covers, may have gone to the boundary had Rahane not thrown himself to his left to stop the ball. Bumrah applauds the effort, he got away with a half-volley
there was a short third man, and a very fine point in place, but no one else deep. Neesham exploits it and sends an almost yorker-length delivery to the third man boundary. Outstanding shot
lands a yorker on leg stump, but Neesham covers for it. Picks up a single to the right of the bowler
had to wait ages to the bouncer to come at him, and having done so, he is in position to pull the ball to deep square leg
full and outside off, Henry taps it to mid-off. Neesham wanted the single, but is sent back. A direct hit from Rahane, moving to his right from cover, could have had him short
full on off stump, driven to mid-off and this time Henry gets across to the other end... and since it's the last ball of the over, he will keep strike
length ball on middle, slower too, Henry goes for the wind up, but the big swing results in an inside edge onto the boot

travels over the fielder at deep midwicket! New Zealand were 199 for 8... They are chugging along at 274 for 8 now. No stalling of momentum. No loss in faith. And here's their No. 10 pulling one of India's fastest bowlers over the boundary
full on leg stump, Henry moves his legs out of the way and flicks the ball through straight midwicket. All along the ground
hammered over extra cover, and he gets a pat on the head from his partner to boot. New Zealand just having fun now. Poor bowling from Yadav though, it was short and wide
clears the front leg against a very full delivery on leg stump and whips it to deep midwicket

that is not at all timed. It's a full toss, but Neesham seems to have got under it too much while trying to smash it down the ground. Skews away to cover, where Jadhav takes a fine catch under pressure. Thats the end of a record partnership for New Zealand for the 9th wicket - 84 in 67 balls
out comes the flamingo. The front leg lifts up off the pitch and the bat comes down straight to keep out a full delivery on of stump
back of a length and outside off, Boult chops the ball down by the stumps and Henry calls him through for a quick single
yorks him on off stump, Henry jams it down to long-on. Good work from Yadav running in and keeping it to a single
backs away to flay the ball through cover, and he would have had it not been for Bumrah trumping him with some very clever change of pace. Flashes a big smile after felling the off stump
back of a length and outside off, Rohit gets back, stands tall and punches to cover
forces him back with a shortish delivery and Rohit works it to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended

all it needs is a bit of width for the batsman to get on top of a ball that had seemed pretty constricting earlier in the over. Henry goes back of a length again, but this time allows Rohit the luxury of extending his arms and carving it through point
steers a shortish delivery behind point

big dive from long leg, can he catch it? It is so close! But the ball lands just beyond his reach! Typically it's a rank ball that creates all the excitement, short, down leg, sweetly pulled by Rohit. But Anderson on the boundary moves quickly to his left and came up just short
defends a fuller delivery in line with the stumps
inswing straight away - at 136 kph - and Rahane, who had his front foot planted on off stump, needed to put bat to ball to avoid being lbw. Finds short midwicket
fuller ball on off stump, checks his drive to mid-off
allows the shortish delivery to come to him as he opens the face, riding it to point
hangs back against the shortish delivery angled across him and times his slice to third man quite perfectly

moves around the wicket for the final ball of the over - this was the angle with which he made Rohit nick off in Delhi - this time though the back of a length ball travels a straight line to and from the middle of the bat. Mid-off is the fielder who has to mop up
gets back as is warranted against a short ball and defends because it was only just outside off
oooh, almost carried to mid-on! It was a little flick from Rahane, I'm not sure if he was intending for the ball to go that straight. That time the good length ball didn't quite come on to the bat
good length ball at 137 kph, pushed to cover. Many fielders in that region

takes a length ball and summarily dismisses it to the midwicket boundary. It wasn't the prettiest shot, nor was it well timed. But all he needed to do was get it over the infield. And he was able to do so with there being just enough room to free the arms

that's all a bit soft! And Henry proves game-changing for New Zealand again. He was celebrating the moment Rahane popped this back of a length ball in the air. It went in the direction of cover, and Santner was the man there. He's a fantastic fielder. Perhaps this pitch isn't quite as true as I thought. That ball certainly stopped on Rahane
back of a length on middle, Kohli moves across to flick it to short midwicket
come to expect that with the Indian team, these quick singles. Rohit defended a fuller delivery with a straight bat and set off right away. Mid-off has to run up, and to his left.
squares him up with a back of a length delivery pitching on off stump and straightening. Edged towards third man. Boult bowling around the wicket seems to be working quite nicely.
stays around the stumps to Rohit and makes him fish at a ball well outside off.  The batsman opened the face to use the pace and find a single at third man
lets the shortish delivery come on, dabs it down with soft hands, looking for a single. But the fielder at point is too quick for such shenanigans
a little room to guide the ball to third man, and Kohli takes it happily
plants the bat like a ramp in line with a back of a length delivery outside off and gets a single to deep third man
shortish on off stump, but Rohit is able to flick it behind square leg, getting just that bit back and across to do so
meets the back of a length delivery on his toes and with a straight bat. Mid-on gets some work

give him the chance to cover drive and he will, more often than not, send you to the boundary, at least in ODIs. It wasn't a half-volley. It was just a superb shot, with the open face making sure to pick the gap between point and cover

dropped by Taylor at a wide slip position. Came right to him, if a little low and to his right. It was an excellent plan from New Zealand. The glide to third man is a very profitable stroke in one-day cricket. It's almost instinctive and Kohli goes for that very shot despite there being a man specifically placed as a catcher. Henry is on his haunches, clutching his hair, looking to tear it out. He had generated some extra bounce. He had surprised one of the world's best batsmen. And yet...
shortish on middle and off, but Kohli gets across and flicks it behind square leg
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
looks to get on top of the bounce and cream it through the covers, but Boult's shortish delivery rises a little too much
uses the angle into him and pulls the short ball from outside off to long leg
immediately Kohli is a lot tighter. Defends a back of a length delivery in line with off stump
banged in short and wide outside off - intended bouncer, and it soars well above Kohli's head
looks to dab the shortish delivery towards point and sneak a quick single, but Guptill is a bit too alert.
flicks the shortish ball on off stump to short midwicket
the short-ball attack continues. Well shortish. Henry pushes Rohit back in his crease, and the flick shot doesn't quite connect. Ball goes off his thigh in front of the wicketkeeper
crisply hit through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, steers to deep third man
back of a length on off stump, defends to mid-on
goes wide of the crease for a length ball outside off, Rohit drives on the up to mid-off
shortish and outside off, slices the ball off the back foot to that wide slip, Taylor remains at that spot
firm punch into the covers as Kohli negotiates a short delivery outside off
he can get this flick to square leg away whenever he wills it. Known him playing those to balls outside off stump. And this one is on the pads, making the job very very easy for Kohli
back of a length and outside off, steers it to that wide slip, on the bounce
moves over the wicket, in the hopes of making sure the short ball he wants to bowl is going across the right-hander, meaning Kohli has to drag it if he wants to pull. And he drags it superbly
tapped into the off side, cover is too far back, the bowler has to abandon his followthrough to get to the ball, and that gives enough time for Kohli to get the single. Superbly orchestrated
shifts around the wicket and bowls back of a length on off stump, Rohit defends

massive appeal from the bowler and the keeper for a caught behind, but Kohli is grinning, shaking his head. He knew he didn't get anything while trying to pull a bouncer on leg stump. Passed over his glove
shuffles across on off stump to flick a back of a length delivery to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defends it

slower ball has him lbw! Lovely change of pace. Rohit didn't quite pick it early enough, and his attempt at adjusting to it comes up short because Southee has also given this ball a bit of offcut. The flick shot comes down outside the line of the ball. He is pinned in line with middle and leg. Umpire Oxenford takes his time but then gives the nod
short ball, outside off, pulled powerfully to backward square leg
back of a length and outside off, ignores it
punches the ball between backward and cover point, but Kohli says no to the single.

he had wandered down the pitch to try and upset the bowler, but Boult reads the play early, digs it short and at Dhoni's body. Beats him for pace. But with the ball falling in no-man's land somewhere to the right of the batsman, Kohli is able to sneak a quick single
back of a length on off stump, defends it under his eyes
slower ball, angled in towards off stump, Kohli wants to glide it to third man but doesn't have the room to do so
back of a length and outside off, runs it down to third man
takes a short ball from outside off and pulls it to deep square leg
offcutter outside off, Dhoni looks to force it off  the back foot through the covers, doesn't quite pull it off

treats Southee like a medium-pacer! Charged down, and when the bowler changed his length to short, Dhoni is still ready to pummel it over straight midwicket. There was a man in the deep there, but he placed it to his left and the power was just breathtaking

one-bounce to the fielder at long leg! The short-ball attack will continue. And New Zealand make sure to line them up outside off so that Dhoni has to drag it with the pull and with that comes the risk of a top-edge
back of a length on off stump, works it to short midwicket
moves inside the line of the ball to try and pull it as fine as possible and avoid the long leg fielder. Doesn't make any connection with this short ball on middle

back of a length slower ball, Kohli read it early, waited for it nicely and clips it to long leg to pick up a well-run couple. Kohli is safe at the strikers' end, Ronchi tries a throw at the non-strikers' and hits Dhoni
full, outside off, and a lot slower. Dhoni is reaching for the ball as he tries to drive into the covers
dug in short and outside off, Dhoni realises it was too high - over shoulder -  to be trifling with
back of a length and outside off, Dhoni gets in line with it and punches it through extra cover. That means the man in the deep has a long distance to cover to his right. Beautiful placement
stands up tall and drills a short delivery through cover
back of a length and outside of, Kohli plays it late and directs it to third man
offcutter outside off, Dhoni taps it to cover
stays back to a reasonably flighted delivery and uses his quick hands to push into the covers
strides forward to a flighted delivery on leg stump and drives along the ground to long-on
tossed up on middle, Dhoni, batting with neither helmet nor cap, drives to short cover.
pushes it down the ground to long-on
powerful roll of the wrists on top of a quicker, fuller delivery on off stump sends the ball to long-on

comes down the track, Santner does well to pull his length back and pitch the ball outside off, in the direction of which Dhoni was advancing. Dabs it to short midwicket for a single and asks for his helmet back
back of a length on off stump, flicks the ball to midwicket. That was a cross-seamed delivery, which provided some extra bounce
drills a shortish delivery outside off to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
short and wide, Dhoni seems like he is  surprised by that ball not bouncing as much as he would like, but is still able to slap it to deep point
full on middle, Kohli places it to the right of mid-on
back of a length ball - not at full pace - beats Dhoni's flick and hits him on the stomach

slices behind point knowing the man in the deep was well in front. First he kept leg side of the ball - which was only on fifth stump - to get the room and then he brought the considerable power of his wrists into play as he opened the face and carves the ball away
works the ball into the midwicket region
comes down the track for a block into the covers
advances again, but with Santner spearing the ball in on middle, he beats Dhoni for pace and strikes him on the pads
continues to skip forward on off stump, defended
tucks the ball to the right of short midwicket.
stands tall and delivers a punch to the sweeper. Got on top of the bounce superbly

the intention was to clear mid-off and he did it in style. I thought that hit the bottom of his bat, but the ball simply soared over the fielder. Length ball, smashed. Seems he had changed his bat before this over began
on the pads and Dhoni flicks it to long leg.

seems risky when he does that, but the ball simply screams away off the bat. It is good length on off stump. Kohli has taken a little stride forward on off stump and if he misses the ball he will be a candidate for lbw. But because that stride is not too long, and he is quick with his hands, he is able to flick the ball to deep midwicket
cuts a short one to point
belts a short ball off the back foot to the right of the sweeper
flighted on leg stump, flicks it just a yard or so to the right of midwicket inside the circle, and then the man in the deep has a long distance to cover to his left. Sublime placement
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
comes down the track, and Santner pulls his length back and fires it in on middle. Dhoni has to adjust and turn it to square leg
flatter delivery, a little too close for him to cut, so he flat bats it to short cover
and with a surge down the pitch and a remorseless hoist over long-off, Dhoni reaches 9000 ODI runs! Third wicketkeeper batsman to the mark. Fifth Indian to the mark.
pushes the ball through to mid-off. That's drinks.
crunched down the ground and Neesham is good enough to stick a right hand out and stop the ball.

smashed it! There was no finesses in that. Just pure, startling power. Saw width. Saw an gap to the left of the sweeper and exploited it before the fielder even knew what was happening. Such strong wrists
steered behind point for a single

bisects long leg and deep square leg! Can't be bowling short at his pace. But Neesham is known to get extra bounce. That's why he goes for that length. This time though it's just a simple, hit-me delivery which Dhoni takes full toll of. That's the fifty partnership too
gets across and glides the shortish delivery to point
shuffles across outside off and flicks a length ball from well outside off to midwicket
nicely flighted on middle and leg, Kohli uses a straight bat to send it to long-on
waits on the shortish delivery outside off and slices the ball behind point
good length ball on middle, Kohli defends it into the covers
goes back in his crease and clips a flatter delivery to the left of short fine leg
comes down the track and deftly turns the length delivery to short fine leg
tries that little dink to short fine leg again having come down the track, but this time he gets a leading edge to the left of the bowler
back of a length and outside off, defended
opens the face and slices the shortish delivery to third man
a hint of room and Dhoni is able to carve the back of a length ball to point
another shortish delivery just outside off, chopped to deep point
full on off stump, Kohli pushes it with a straight bat, intending to find mid-on, but Santner moves to his left from midwicket and prevents the single

goes wide of the crease, but the acute angle into the pads gives Kohli the best chance to make the most of his flick. Placed it to the left of short fine leg and moves to another serene fifty in a big chase
skips down the track and the flatter delivery is sent to long-on
shortish and outside off, Kohli makes room and punches it with a straight bat to the sweeper
goes wide of the crease to spear a fuller ball into the pads, Dhoni clips it to backward square leg

bashed down the ground! That massive bat swing would make the ball cringe if it could feel emotion. The error here from Santner is that he gave Dhoni room to free the arms. So even if he shortened the length, it didn't matter. Only gave the batsman the chance to get under the ball better
gets down the pitch, but Santner bowls slower, and pulls his length back. Pins him on the pads
a little turn outside off, as he bowls flat to prevent Dhoni from running at him. Eased to point
slower bouncer on middle and leg, Kohli moved across to pull it to fine leg, but got a bit of a top-edge. Ronchi moves to his left and dives forward, but he couldn't get under the ball. Had no chance
another slower ball on off stump, defended in front of point
back of a length and outside off stump as Southee goes wide of the crease, Kohli waits for it and plays a late cut
full on off stump, Dhoni plays a flick, intending for the ball to go through midwicket, but the inside edge takes it squarer.
punches a shortish ball to long-on
wide of the crease for a bouncer - but it goes well above Dhoni's head as he left the ball, called a wide

another wide, this one for the line. It's back of a length and wandering down leg. Ronchi is blinded by the batsman, standing up to the stumps, and has a long distance to move to his right. Doesn't quite collect it cleanly
back of a length and outside off, punched to point
flighted on off stump, driven to the left of short cover, and Guptill does well to prevent a run
moves back and flicks a flatter delivery on off stump through midwicket
fuller delivery on off stump to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, driven to cover
stays back to a length ball and steers it in front of backward point, Kohli wanted the single, Dhoni responded immediately, simply done. Kohli applauds his captain, Dhoni just shrugs and nods
flighted on off stump, pushed to long-on
back of a length and outside off, drilled into the covers
back of a length delivery on off stump, driven to mid-off
bouncer at 108 kph - getting up to his nose - Dhoni moves inside the line and pulling it through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, slides it to deep third man
punches a shortish delivery back at the bowler

short and wide, carves it to the left of point inside the circle and well to the right of the man in the deep. Lessons in placement for all watching. Dhoni waited just that little bit and then put all of his considerable power into the shot to beat the two fielders
flighted on off stump, defended
stands up tall on off stump and drills it to long-on
comes down track, but Santner is able to cramp Dhoni up. Misses the flick shot
flighted on off stump, driven past cover to long-off
scythes an extra cover drive, making sure he stays leg side of the tossed up delivery to give himself the best chance to executed it.
comes down the track and flicks the ball through midwicket
shortish and outside off, chopped to point

shortish on off stump, Dhoni taps it on top of the bounce through midwicket for his first ODI fifty in a year. Some of that is because he bats too low. Came in at No. 4 today and has controlled the chase very well
short and outside off, Kohli swivels on the back foot and turns the ball to long leg
gets an inside edge towards long leg as he tried to force a shortish delivery through the covers
goes for a bouncer outside off, Kohli evades it
back of a length and outside off, eases it to backward point.
and he starts off with a wide down leg, Dhoni tries a flick but misses
short, wide, slapped to deep point. There may be more than 150 runs to get, but Dhoni and Kohli are going about the chase so sensibly
good length ball on off stump, Kohli defends it into the off side and looks for a quick single. Dhoni says no
takes a good length ball on the up and drills it to short cover. Lovely straight bat
waits on the shortish delivery and dabs it to the left of Guptill at point, Dhoni waits for the ball to pass the fielder before agreeing to the single

that is sublime! He seems to be telling Neesham I could do this to you all day, striding down the track, taking a full delivery and launching it into the sightscreen. Such a straight bat. And all timing. Overtakes Tendulkar as the Indian with the most sixes in ODIs
short ball, slower as well, Dhoni comes down the track and pulls it to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, flicked to long leg
back of a length on off stump, turned to long leg. Bowling around the wicket to both right-handers

too much work for deep midwicket! Boult goes short, and it doesn't rise anywhere near a region where the batsman would feel threatened. Dhoni swivels on the back foot and places it to the right of Latham
fuller ball outside off, slices it to deep point
lets the shortish delivery come on, at off stump, and tap it to third man
shortish on the pads, with Boult coming around the stumps, dabbed to long leg

133 kph, but the ball held up on the pitch, and bounced considerably higher than Dhoni expected. It was the cross-seamer, hitting the bat face where it meets the handle, and it popped back to the right of the pitch
worked away into the midwicket region
shortish and outside off, Dhoni pushes his hands in front of his body and takes great care to push the ball down into the covers
slower ball on leg stump, nudged to backward square leg
doesn't do much else but get low as he sees a full ball outside off and drills it to the right of Latham at sweeper cover
shortish on middle, bouncing considerably as well, Dhoni is pushed off his toes to glance it to short fine leg
back of a length and outside off, Kohli tries to force it through the covers and mistimes the ball
117 kph, outside edge, no slips, too fine for the third man to stop! With mid-off and cover up, he felt confident enough to beat them but the lack of pace beats him
shortish and outside off, slides it off the open face to third man
fuller delivery outside off, driven to cover
pitched up on off stump, driven to short cover
driven to mid-off
shortish delivery on leg stump, flicked to long leg
back of a length and outside off, pushed to mid-off
the lack of pace beats Kohli, mostly because he was trying to use the pace of the ball and glide it to third man
shortish delivery on off stump, Kohli makes sure to get on top of the bounce and play with a straight bat to midwicket.
shortish on leg stump, dabs it to short fine leg
fuller delivery outside off, driven to deep cover
meets a short ball outside off with a backfoot punch through cover
collars a slow, short ball from way outside off stump and pulls it to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Dhoni pats it to mid-off
good length, but on the pads, Kohli clips it to long leg and get through for a couple. Kohli was stretched to make it back, but he pushed himself to do so and took great big gasps later
works a fuller ball into the midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, pushed to long-on
strides down the pitch to a good length ball and drives it to deep cover
another shot played out of the crease, the short ball outside off ends up at deep cover again
short delivery outside off, slashed to deep point
loopy, tennis-ball bounce as Neesham goes for a bouncer down the leg side. Dhoni just watches it dance past him
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off for a single
shortish and outside off, cut to point

one-bounce four to the midwicket fence and Kohli makes a weird face as he watches the ball fly. The short ball down leg had stopped on him a bit, but he did well to go through with the shot and still place it well to the left of the man in the deep
shortish on off stump, gets on top of the bounce to dab into the covers
full outside off, driven to mid-off. Was looking to go through the covers, but got through his shot too early
back of a length on off stump, punched back towards the bowler
fullish outside off, and that's a Kohli special. Just whips it away, loads of bottom hand, up and over the infield to the wide long-on boundary
short outside off, leans back and late-cuts to third man
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, looks for a single after a soft-hands dab towards point, but Dhoni sends him back
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on
back of a length on off and middle, defended into the covers
jumps out and Santner shortens his length. Dhoni punches back to the bowler
down the track again, Santner looks to fire it a little shorter and into his legs. He plays a typical straight-bat push to the right of midwicket to get off strike
length ball on middle stump, Kohli gets on the front foot, pushes to the left of cover, and calls for the quick single immediately
crunched to the left of mid-off, standing up tall to make sure the back of a length ball doesn't get too big on him
short and wide outside off, Dhoni flat bats it to short cover
brings up the 150 partnership with a ferocious strike down the ground. Henry goes for the yorker, was he put off by the dew? It becomes a low full toss, ripe for the hit
shortish and outside off, cut to cover

he's struck! With that back of a length ball that New Zealand like. And it is precisely for this reason that they like it - some hold onto the dry pitch and if a batsman is driving on the up, there is every chance he could be caught. That's why they have a short cover in the 36th over. Dhoni was left reaching for the ball, mistimes the shot and Taylor takes the catch
fuller ball on off stump, defended
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
takes a good length ball from off stump and taps it to backward point
pushes his hands at a flighted delivery outside off, and gets an inside edge with this dewy ball going on with the arm
good length and outside off, blocked with the open face and his hands away from his body
tight line on middle, Pandey pats it back at the bowler. Quicker delivery, in line with the stumps, to try and catch the batsman unawares. Just one run off the over so far
turn now as he hits a good length outside off, forcing the new batsman who wouldn't quite be comfortable enough to move his feet to play thrust his hands out. Beats Pandey. Lovely bowling.

beautiful shot! Shows you he feels very little pressure. Saw a shortish delivery outside off, realised it had pace that he could use and simply guided the ball to the left of third man. No reason to panic and hit big shots
but to the new batsman a bit shot is a relief. Pandey doesn't care it's a short ball, he is on the front foot and flat bats the ball over the bowler's head
goes for the bouncer on middle, Pandey avoids it. Good move. He's got the boundary. Now he has to settle
pushed into the gap between cover and mid-off
opens the face and runs the shortish delivery to third man
back of a length and outside off, steered to point
on the pads and Pandey flicks it to deep midwicket
tossed up, nice and slow, Pandey defends stretching forward
good length ball, a little quicker on off stump, defended
goes wide of the crease for a dart on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
went back to a good length ball and wanted to flick it to midwicket, but it turns sharply enough to beat the leading edge and hit him on the back thigh
loopy delivery outside of, but Kohli still prefers to stay back and carves it through to the sweeper
pushed through on off stump, defended. Ends a good spell from Santner, only 43 runs in his 10 overs. Been a top performer in this tour
back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid-off
waits on the shortish delivery outside off and dabs it to deep third man
shortish on leg stump, flicked to long leg

just over point! Sensing the need for a boundary Kohli went after a wide delivery and hit it with all his power. Got it well over Guptill, who is quite a tall man, but even with him leaping up as far as he could, he had chance
glorious! He has taken a ball from middle stump, rising up to his stomach, and whips it to the left of fine leg. Punches the air at getting the placement perfectly.
moves onto 99 with a gentle little glide to third man

and there it is! Century No. 26. A simple raise of the bat after a simple dab to third man. Then he goes on to fix the grip of his handle. Gee, must think chasing is so blase. It's his 16th ton in the second innings of an ODI
overpitched on off stump and Pandey has thumped it over the bowler's head. Neesham's return to the bowling crease hasn't been quite as rosy as he would want
back of a length on off stump, nudged to short midwicket
shortish and outside off, eased to deep third man
full and wide outside off, Kohli gets a thick outside edge to deep third man
back of a length slower ball outside off, Pandey recognises it and steers the ball to deep third man
slower ball to start with, Pandey takes it from off stump and steers it to third man
sweetly done. Never in a rush, never in a panic. Sees third man was up, sees this short ball had a little bit of width. Simply gave it a little nudge to the left of that fielder
flicked into the midwicket region
backed away, Boult followed him with a short ball, Pandey immediately provides a ramp for the ball to soar over the wicketkeeper. Superb work
length ball on leg stump, pushed to mid-on. Seemed like the slower one too
full and down leg, Pandey tries a flick but he couldn't quite reach it. India will be happy for the extra
drives a fuller delivery outside off through the covers
slower short ball, and Pandey drags it from outside off to midwicket
fuller delivery outside off, driven to long-on
drives to short cover with a very straight bat
shortish delivery on off stump, flicked to deep square leg. Never seems to run out of energy. Spent almost  the entire innings out in the middle, but he still gets those twos in
short ball on off stump, pulled between deep midwicket and deep square leg. Two on offer, Kohli grabs it greedily
back of a length and outside off, given a detour to third man
the ball spins to the left with Kohli slicing the ball with the open face, Anderson did not account for that and overran  it at the cover boundary.
length on off stump, slapped over the top to long-off
back of a length on off stump, patted down to long-on. Latham rushes to his left from midwicket and dives, but he can't reach the ball
full and outside off, Kohli slices it to backward point
wanted to steer a good length ball to point, but the lack of pace makes him chop it down by his feet
"two, two, two, come back," yells Kohli after he moves across to a back of a length delivery on off stump and flicks it through to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid-on
driven to mid-off, and with the man on the edge of the circle, it's a simple single
width offered, Pandey makes a little of his own as well to slash a length ball through to the sweeper cover
shortish and outside off, Kohli gets up on his toes and whips the ball to long-on
moves away from the shortish delivery and flicks it to mid-on
short and wide, Kohli dabs it to deep third man. That region's been very profitable for him in this innings, 28 runs, 20 singles, four twos
doesn't matter if it's a new bowler, steers the length ball on off stump to third man.
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-on
backs away and slaps the shortish delivery to deep cover
hasn't played too many of those this innings, but when the wide half-volley arrives, Kohli drills it through extra cover, past the left of Williamson. The placement of his cover drives are scary good
too full for him to stay back and glide to third man.
lands the yorker on off stump, Kohli makes it a run-scoring opportunity by getting low with the ball and steering it with the open face to third man
back of a length and outside off, punched to the sweeper. It was to the left of the man, Santner, who has a good arm, and yet that is enough for him to complete a second.
back of a length on off stump, pushed to mid-off
waits on the shortish delivery and guides it to deep third man
fuller delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
wanted to hit it through the covers, but he inside edges the ball towards mid-on
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
bowler searches for the blockhole, Kohli smirks and sends him to the boundary. Eyes on the ball all the way thorugh, gets low, opens the face and beats the sweeper on his left
now a whip of the wrists over the front foot takes the ball over midwicket. Length ball dispatched
mid-off was up, so he goes over him! Back of a length, launched to the boundary. This is the highest score at Mohali.
extension of the defence. That's all it was. The ball was overpitched on middle from around the wicket, and Kohli send it to crash into the sightscreen
full on leg stump, flicked to the right of long-on to bring up Kohli's 150! A big wave of the bat, round and round over his head, to his adoring fans
carves the wide yorker to the backward point boundary. That's 22 runs in the over, and India need only one more for victory!
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers.
pulled to the midwicket boundary! Pandey just wanted to be done with the game with the field coming up so he just slogs the short ball away
